cont.entity_a: Well-balanced, comfortable wireless mouse with excellent ergonomics.
cont.entity_b: Ergonomic design helps with wrist and hand pain relief.

cont.entity_a: Allows on-the-fly resolution changes for better gaming accuracy.
cont.entity_b: High mouse speed without adjustment options.

cont.entity_a: Comes with two batteries, allowing for hot swapping without docking. Battery life is short, especially during gaming, requiring frequent changes.
Accuracy is comparable to wired mice, but can experience jerky pointer movement.
Suffers from Wi-Fi interference, affecting performance.
Durability issues with left button and scroll wheel over time.
cont.entity_b: Made from cheap plastic, with fragile thumb-buttons.

cont.entity_a: Rough plastic sides may not be preferred.
Logitech customer service is responsive but not always effective.
Overall, a great mouse for gaming, but battery and interference issues may be a concern.
cont.entity_b: Suitable for users with wrist pain but not for gaming.
Lacks a scroll wheel, limiting functionality.
Not compatible with Windows 10, causing inconsistency.
Works only on certain surfaces, like a pants leg.
Requires whole arm movement, which can be cumbersome.
